body.name: Baby Bottle Handles for Philips Avent Anti-Colic and AirFree Vent Baby Bottles, Compatible Avent Bottle Holder, 4 Count
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 19 hrs 15 mins
features: One Size Fits All - Bottle handles are compatible with Avent Anti-Colic Baby Feeding Bottles. Fit all 4oz, 9oz and 11oz bottles.

Unique Design - The baby bottle handle for Philips Avent adopts a heart-shaped design, which is small and convenient, which makes it easy for babies to grasp the handle and drink milk from the bottle by themselves.
100% Baby Safe - Made from premium food-grade PP materials, our bottle handles are BPA free, phthalate free, latex free and lead free.
Easy To Install - The correct installation method of the handle is to put it on the mouth of the bottle and tighten the bottle cap to fix it, not to get stuck on the bottle.

This is an after-sales product specially produced by XUNICUTE Products and not associated with PHILIPS. If you have any questions about our product, please feel free to contact us to provide you with a solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for babies learning to hold bottles
reviews.reviewText: Fits the bottle well. Handles are a good size for little hands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helps baby learn to hold bottles.
reviews.reviewText: Quick to add on to bottles and makes them easier for travel with little ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Takes time but baby is happy trying to use it
reviews.reviewText: Baby always want to hold his bottle and now he can. The reason for the 4 stars is due to the ergonomics of the handle. I love it because it’s easy to clean and durable in case the bottle drops. But the way the handle is shaped makes it a little hard for baby to wrap his hands around it. If they wet rounder and not flat maybe it’ll be more comfortable. Good thing my baby loves to keep trying. Wondering if a silicone handle would work better and if that even exists. At least it fits the bottle very well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The best my son love it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: They do fit the bottle and serve a good purpose. My baby is almost 5 months and begin to try to hold his bottle. He isn’t quite ready for these because they are not stationary. But I’m sure with a baby that has more control they will be perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are perfect for the avent bottles. My daughter really did not like using the handles - she prefers to just hold the bottle. I would highly suggest to any kids who do not want to hold their own bottle. It just did work out that way for us!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are a great addition to an already great bottle. They make it easier to hold the bottle yourself or for baby to try and hold on. The handles fit securely and show no sign of coming off when in use. They are durable and easy to clean along with the bottles. The shape of the handle is not ideal for tiny hands to hold but will get easier as they grow.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected - hard plastic
reviews.reviewText: The handles are made of a hard plastic. This kind of caught my off guard because I was expecting something a bit more flexible. The edges aren't sharp or anything and attaching it to bottles is very simple. Just place the handle on top of an uncapped bottle then screw on the cap or nipple. The pressure from the cap keeps the handle in place. Based on the tightness of the cap, the handle may or may not allow the bottle to spin just a little. Removing the handle takes the same steps just in reverse; remove the top and the handle slips right off.It fit very well on Philip brand bottles. Other bottles were VERY hit or miss, with more misses than hits in my experience.
